Reviews.Title: Great Waterproof Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I have only used this camera underwater once so far, but it was absolutely fantastic.  I took it to the swimming pool with my daughter and niece as a test run, and got some great shots of my niece swimming underwater, and alternated with underwater shots and above the water shots.  The camera is made to slough off the water as soon as you pull it out, so the pictures out of the water don't have spots or water drops on them.  It seems like a minor thing, but it really made a huge difference.  As for being waterproof, it seemed to hold up great.  After we got home, I noticed it had some chlorine spots on a couple pictures (after I tried to use a dry cleaning cloth on it) so I soaked it in a sink full of clean water for about 5 minutes, and voila!  Perfect photos again.  I've seen some reviews that say this camera doesn't work well inside, haven't noticed a problem myself.  Pretty much every single picture I've taken with the camera has turned out with great color balance and good lighting.  I have had a couple overexpose a bit with the flash, but hey, this is a point and shoot camera, not a professional grade camera.  The overexposure can be fixed on the camera itself with the offered image editing or with editing software on your computer.We'll be taking the camera on a trip to the lake in a week, so we'll see how it holds up with the sand and murky water, but so far I am more than pleased with this little camera, especially for the price!  Can't wait to take it out and play with it some more.EDIT: Used this camera on a trip in pools, lakes, and rivers.  Had a blast.  Got some great shots in the water, above the water, canoeing, kayaking, and even in a water feature fountain thing for the kids to play in, all with no worries about water leakage.  I do recommend purchasing a floating wrist strap because the camera itself doesn't float if you drop it in deep water.  Even in the lake and river the pictures came out great, though you need to be close to your subject in dirtier/murkier water.  After a month and a couple weeks, I'd say it's already earned its keep for the price I paid.  I think we took somewhere around 1600 photos on a two week trip with this little camera, and 99% of them were fantastic.  I also bought an extra extended life battery, and with constant shooting, I did need to change the batteries about once a day.  But, I take a LOT of photos.EDIT2:  After reading some of the other reviews here, I think something needs to be said - this is NOT an expensive, professional level camera.  It isn't being sold as one, because it's not.  No, you are not going to get perfect pictures every single time.  You're not going to get perfectly clear-as-day underwater photos (although you will get some awesome ones).  This is a point-and-shoot camera that you can take in the water with you.  If you expect more than point-and-shoot quality, you should not buy this camera.  But understand you will spend more money on something else.  For the average user, it is an absolutely fantastic camera for the price.  You can take it anywhere, it fits in your POCKET (how nice is that?) and it will stand up to being dropped, getting wet, getting cold, etc.  Take it on your family vacation without worrying about it.  Now try to do that with a $3000 professional camera.  Also, for people saying the quality sucks, I have blown up some of the photos from this camera to 16x20 prints and hung them on the wall.  I certainly can't tell they were taken with a $140 camera, and neither can anyone else.

Reviews.Title: Don't know much about cameras but I like this one...
Reviews.Author: Mike Jacobs
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 2: Just noticed another issue. The flash sometimes causes a bit of reflection the color of my finger along the right side of the imate, evidently becuase my fingers are too close (to the flash). This isn't an issue, I just move my fingers a bit. Good thing I preview work-pictures, though. I can't tell you how much I am appreciating the water and dust-proofing in this SE Florida monsoon season! No change in the rating.UPDATE 1: Since purchasing I've used this quite a bit for work and personal photos. I still love the camera - I've been able to take pics in rain, around water and with a 4 year old hanging all over me without worrying about dust, water or dropping it. However, there are a couple of issues I haven't seen in other reviews: (1) the lens is easily "dirtied" by a finger print when you take this out of your pocket (no cover), and (2) I have to be more careful about taking photos in the direction of the sun or I sometimes get a big glare-streak... don't know why my other cameras didn't have this problem but it sometimes requires two hands (one to block the sun). These issues have not changed my rating.ORIGINAL REVIEW: Lots of camera-geek analysis here, and from what I read Panasonic meets my criteria - fast cycle after shooting, wide angle, durable and mainstream ("reliable") manufacturer. I mostly take photos for work, and any modern camera is satisfactory for family use.This has a wider angle than my Canon PowerShot, which I am replacing, and no moving parts. I can shoot in the rain and carry it in my shirt pocket, neither of which are feasible with the Canon. The unit is "closed" so that I won't get construction dust or lint inside the lenses, which is why I need to replace my Canon.Other than that, it's just a nice camera that I can get wet or drop, with all the usual bells and whistles (90% of which I'll never use). The price:value ratio is very good for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Testing waterproof cameras
Reviews.Author: Sephwin
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 waterproof cameras to take with me on vacation to the Bahamas (Used the Consumers Report to pick the cameras). The Nikon Coolpix AW110, Olympus TG2, and Panasonic Lumix FS5. I like the Nikon best for it's true color in and out of water, Olympus for the functions, and Lumix for it's all around used. I found that these three cameras works great if you follow the instructions, like going too deep underwater (Cause to leak and stop the cameras from working) or opening the seal to download your picture without making sure that the cameras have the same temperature as the surrounding environments (this can cause fogging in the lens). Always clean the cameras after used. After my testing, I let my friends barrow the cameras for their used to the beach, pools, snowboarding, and military deployment. The verdict is that my friend love the Lumix most. Great pictures in and out of water. Rugged, the camera survive being drop (snow, water, mud, sand, and even concrete less than 5 ft.). The price also help, it is the cheapest of the three. Panasonic Lumix waterproof camera performed better than what is advertise.US Army Soldier station in Germany.

Reviews.Title: Works Well.
Reviews.Author: DianeB
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to Mexico with us on vacation.  The camera worked well and took some good pictures in and out of the water, as long as you used the normal optical zoom.  My only complaint would be that the Intelligent zoom does not work very well, it's a bit grainy, especially in low light and under water.  Saying that it has an 8X zoom is a bit misleading, since it is not a true optical zoom.  Had no problems with leakage and we snorkeled for a couple of hours.  My husband has an older model that has manual modes and a lot more picture options.  Next time I would go with a higher end model to have those options.  This camera is very small which can make it a bit hard to hold on to and the movie mode button is so small it is hard to push, especially if you had larger fingers.  All in all I like the camera, but some small changes could make it much better.

Reviews.Title: Self Destructs
Reviews.Author: David White
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for its advertised ability to take underwater photos.After following the waterproofing instructions to the letter it did take threeunderwater pictures then promptly died.  It is now useless and only aftertaking three pictures. This camera obviously has a very severe design flaw.Now we have to try to convince the company to exchange or refund our moneyI am not sure how that is going to turn out. If it is an exchange I will notallow this camera near water again.If you are considering an underwater camera, Definately, DefinatelyLOOK ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera but I sent it back for a few reasons...
Reviews.Author: S. Olson
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to receive this camera prior to going on a vacation to Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. On first use, it was great! I took a lot of pictures in the LAX airport and upon arrival to Cancun (where we flew in). It worked great. Powered on fast, fast shutter speed, fast focusing, and it took good quality pictures as I found out once downloading them to my laptop.I used the camera in the pool and at the beach. Waterproof? Absolutely! I can only attest to its water integrity to about 3-4 feet, but it passed with flying colors. No leaks! Floats well with the floating wrist straps.The second day of our trip I noticed a slight fogging of the lens on the inside. I had read that once you open the case (you have to do download pics) you can allow moisture in. It's very hot and humid in Playa Del Carmen so that's likely what happened. From this point on the camera was useless for the trip. I wasn't going to hold it against the camera because that's just the way it goes once moisture gets into something. But my sister bought the same camera for this trip and she never opened the case the entire time. Her's also began to fog up (not as severe as mine) and that's what really worried me. Waterproof cameras are awesome, but when they fog up, that's that! You can get strips to put inside the latch to absorb the moisture, but I didn't have that at the time.I was still set on keeping the camera but I also discovered later that the video was a bit grainy. I thought it must have been set to a lower setting, but it was full quality. I have a Casio EX-S10 that takes much better quality video (and audio) than this camera and it has less lines of resolution.So anyway...the camera went back today because I don't feel it lived up to the advertisement. I'm pretty fair in my opinions when it comes to my gadgets, so I gave an honest assessment of this product. It's a good camera, and the fogging could probably be corrected with adding strips to absorb the moisture, but the video was the deal breaker for me.3 out of 5 stars. Good, but could be better.

Reviews.Title: This camera made my wonderfu trip to the Great Barrier Reef fabulous!
Reviews.Author: MWM
Reviews.Content: This camera was a last minute purchase. I had everything packed for my trip to Australia and had not done enough homework to warrant buying a waterproof camera. A good friend came over, checked the specs on what was available and not too expensive, and recommended this one. I ordered it Prime, received it, packed it, read the instructions on the plane, and then used it to photograph divers on the Gold Coast and underwater coral and fish! This camera lived up to and exceeded all expectations. It never leaked. The battery time was fine. The photos and videos were spectacular. I followed the instructions on how to desalt it in freshwater and it came back time after time. With the exception of the prescription diving mask that I bought, this was my second most important purchase for my trip.

Reviews.Title: 2 cameras, both leaked
Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased camera #1 for a trip to Belize last year. It worked well for the first day snorkeling in 8 feet of water, then leaked the 2nd day. The instructions are VERY precise describing how to ensure a waterproof seal and there is NO room for error. I followed the instructions exactly and this camera still leaked. The photos from day #1 however, were excellent. I returned the camera and received a replacement. I'm not sure if salt water is the problem, but the battery terminals were heavily corroded.I just returned from a trip to St. Croix. The camera did not make it through day #1. Again, I followed the instructions precisely and the seal did not hold. I do not recommend buying this camera. I met a couple on vacation with a Canon PowerShot D10 camera that they have had for three years with absolutely no problem. This Panasonic camera is finicky and requires a surgeon's precision to operate.

Reviews.Title: Safe to take fishing
Reviews.Author: JoEri "woodswoman"
Reviews.Content: Fell in the stream when I was fly fishing.  I always take a camera along.  Needless to say I ruined it.  Decided to replace that camera AND get this one.  I love Lumix cameras because of the ease of shooting photos, the support from Panasonic (which I do not have to use often), and the wonderful photos.  I look forward to taking it into the stream when we fly fish soon in Colorado.

Reviews.Title: Echo other reviews of poor quality waterproofing
Reviews.Author: ra_rush "ra_rush"
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed to have to echo other reviews of poor quality.  I was initially very happy with the picture quality.... then the camera got wet ( pool, not deep ).  It took pics in the pool, but the next time I started it the screed was not clear - to the point of being unusable.  As soon as I'm back from my trip, this is back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Poor workmanship and worst customer service(Panasonic)
Reviews.Author: Early Riser "Early Riser"
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd Lumix I had this year.  The first was damaged in a fall so it was replaced by the insurance company. The replacement had such a shutter lag i missed most of my shots.  I called Amazon and they replaced it with no problem.  It seemed slow, but not as bad as the previous one.  I took it in Oct (from purchasing in July of this year) on a Snorkel Trip.  After the first 5 pictures it leaked, badly.  I have been taking pictures underwater for sometime, so I know everything was checked and double-checked.  I called Panasonic when I got  back and they told me to expect a claim number and label in my email in 48hrs.  well, 48 came and went.  I called in again, and they told me the plant, or whomever was in Texas would not issue a label.  I would have to pay to have it sent to be inspected.  I requested to speak with a supervisor since this was a 3 month old camera.  They said someone would call.  That was last month.  I gave up on them and called my insurance company and filed a claim, which they took care of immediately, INCLUDING the shipping label.I will NEVER BY PANASONIC AGAIN.  Why deal with a company who will not back up their own products.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: anna
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on my honeymoon to the caribbean.  I love it.  The instructions are clear, it is very easy to use and I am delighted with how my pictures turned out- above water and under water.  Only con is that I wish it would zoom a little more.  For the price, I'm super happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: kerwin8r
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui and reviewed all of our pictures and videos.  Everything came out great. Camera worked at depths of 10 ft+ while doing Snuba.  Got great pics and video of reef fish and sea turtles! Pools, waterfalls, dry land, jungle zip lining through the air, panorama shots, this camera did it all and did it well.  Combined with a Transcend 300X 32GB sd card. Only used 4GB on a week long trip.Make sure you keep the orange seal area clean after opening to remove memory card or charge the battery and you should have no issues with water getting in. I also did not notice any fogging of the lens. Highly recommend this camera and thought it worked as well or better than any of my Canon point and shoots I have had in the past.

Reviews.Title: This camera is NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: George Harris
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera to take underwater pictures during a dream vacation.  I followed all instructions.  Within about 2 minutes the camera began leaking and was ruined!  I was only in about 3 feet of water at the time.

Reviews.Title: Water proof camera
Reviews.Author: Skeet
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera for the money, used it on shore excursions on cruise,  took it in water and tubing worked well. Good quality pictures .Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: A handy little camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Pereira
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot. It was purchased for a cruise where I had planned a couple of snorkeling excursions. It performed just fine...not the best pictures I've ever taken, but it did the job for very little money. I'd never had the illusion that I'd be a master underwater photographer, so I wasn't disappointed with the pictures I got.  Some were fantastic and others were total crap...it totally depended on the light and my (lack of) ability to manage to stay in one spot and not be tossed around by the current.PROS:Cost...hello...I got this camera for at least sixty bucks less (thanks Amazon) than it was being sold in local shops or on the cruise ship itself.Size...it's tiny...so tiny that it fit in the pocket of my very small bathing suit.Picture Quality...on land it did a fine job for an affordable point and shooter. In fact, I was very surprised at the quality of some of my shots. Given the right light and circumstance the pictures turned out beautifully.Water Resistance....that's right. I didn't say 'water proof'. Nothing is water proof if you can open it up. While I did have one instance where there was a tiny bit of fog on the inside of the lens...I just opened it up and let it dry out while I ate lunch. Presto! Clear again. But, otherwise...no problem while being underwater for a couple hours.Cuteness...It probably doesn't count to many people...but, this darn camera is a cutie pie. I was proud to pull it out and it always caught somebody's eye.CONS:Picture Quality...yep...it's under Pros too. It's probably not the camera's fault but I must have taken a hundred pictures underwater and I ended up keeping about fifteen of them. The clarity of the pictures wasn't the best...but, again, that's probably due to the fact that I was underwater that isn't as clear as the air.  (duh.)Software...the photo viewing/editing software that Panasonic offers is crap. I ended up just moving all the pics from the SD card over to my Kodak easyshare software.SD Card....this camera uses a regular sized SD card and not the micro DS card that I already had.  But, I solved that problem by buying an adapter. When that is number three on my CONS list...you know it's not a big problem, right? The camera did happen to handle my 32 gb high speed micro sd card beautifully....no drag at all. Pics were saved super quick and I could take another shot in a second.That's it...I would really recommend this camera to anyone going on a vacation when they don't want to risk using their phone or a nicer camera.  It worked well enough underwater and just fine above water.  I'll probably still use my phone as my every day shooter and my digital SLR for other stuff. But, for cruises and pics by the water....I'll take this little gem with me.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Jason Pele
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera in both fresh water and the ocean, as well as pools and it hasn't leaked or had any noticable problems yet.  For the price, the pictures it takes are good enough quality for me.  I wouldn't reccomend it for diving or scuba, but it's a great camera to have around during the summer when out at the pool or beach.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Christel
Reviews.Content: Im satisfied with the pictures it takes under water, as a point and shoot camera is ok as well, if used a lot of zoom since it's digital the pictures dont look so great, but that is expected. Overall the camera works for what is intended water activities pictures.

Reviews.Title: River Rafting
Reviews.Author: Lance S. Micklus "Lance M"

} } } Length:: 7:09 MinsI bought this camera a few weeks before taking a cruise. This video of river rafting was taken on February 25, 2014 in Ocho Rios, Jamaica. The battery lasted the entire safari - about an hour and a half, but then it was dead. The original sound was in mono but was cleaned up and then synthesized to stereo. The video was not processed - what you see is what the camera took. I had the camera mounted on a bobber which I held in my hand. The bobber was attached to my wrist with a tether.One thing to be aware of with this camera is that when taking video, you may hear clicking sounds in the audio - which is why I gave it a four star rating instead of five. The clicks are the sound of the aperture adjusting to changing light conditions. This is not a defect. It's mentioned in the instruction manual. However, if the sound you're recording is very loud, you probably won't notice the clicks.

Reviews.Title: RUN AWAY: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Pcitiyank
Reviews.Content: In spite of reading and following instructions, this has leaked since the first time I used it in The Galapagos.  It has been used for snorkeling and land only.  It has received careful care and no harsh usage.  I have been able to dry it out (mostly) several times, but it leaks about every time and now the view window is foggy. I have not been able to download to see if it is actually taking pictures and hope what was on my card is not ruined.  On a snorkel trip today, a fellow snorkeler said this camera is what she originally purchased and she had the same experience.  She said Panasonic replaced it and it happened to the replacement, as well. I looked closely at her Nikon Coolpix (about twice the price) and see a big difference.  The Lumix has a snap closure, so you cannot control the pressure of the seal. Poor design and/or poor manufacturing.  The Nikon Coolpix has a compression closure, so you can have some control of the seal.  I am off to Costco to buy a Nikon Coolpix so I can enjoy the rest of my Maui vacation.

Reviews.Title: A step backwards for Lumix in image quality
Reviews.Author: C. Floyd "floydiak"
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of Panasonic's Lumix line, and own several dating back to the DMC-FZ7.  I bought the DMC-TS25 to replace a DMC-TS3 (the -TS3 had a cracked rear screen that made it no longer waterproof, but it still functioned normally).  I used the two cameras side-by-side for several weeks, and noticed the older, damaged -TS3 still took much sharper, more vivid photos than the -TS25.  The -TS25's macro capability was also markedly inferior to the -TS3.  I've since returned the -TS25; the damaged -TS3 is still in use.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna
Reviews.Content: I really love everything about this camera, it works under the water, it makes nice videos and of  course great pics:-)

Reviews.Title: I spent hours workshopping the dust specs!
Reviews.Author: Lea
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to replace an Olympus Tough series camera.  I haven't had it very long but I am sending it back.Pros:Compact camera is easy to tuck into a pocketCamera gets good reviews for toughness and waterproof capabilities (I have not had time to test it for this)Cons:You have to navigate a lot of menus to use the different scene selectors.  It takes too long when you are trying to get shots of people in motion.The auto setting over-exposes everything.  All of my photos are hazy, grainy and dull.  I get better quality from my iPhone 5There is no lens cover.  Every time you take it out to use it you must dust the lens.  My husband didn't realize this, and now I am spending hours retouching the dust specs from our Thanksgiving celebration photos.The camera is fine if you just want to record incidental stuff, but I can do that with my phone.  I need something that will fit in my pocket, stand up to my two three-year-olds AND take sharp photos.  If I'm only going to get two out of three I will give up the size or the durability, but if I'm going to carry an extra device I will NOT give up the sharp photos!

Reviews.Title: Used on a night Manta ray dive on the Big Island..
Reviews.Author: Judith K. Walter
Reviews.Content: Really liked the idea of a completely waterproof camera and this worked really well on a recent trip to Hawaii.  Here is the video of a night snorkel shot with the camera off of the airport in Kona.  [...]

Reviews.Title: VERY satisfied with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Y4S
Reviews.Content: I needed a waterproof camera mainly to use when I'm taking pics of the kids at the waterpark and whatnot.  I am pretty picky when it comes to what I expect out of a camera even when I'm not spending a fortune. I see it as, "What's the point of a camera if all the pictures are terrible quality?" I bought and tried several comparable waterproofs before returning them.  I tried an Olympus one and WOW, what a joke! I couldn't believe how awful it was. This is SO MUCH BETTER.  If you're looking to get pretty decent pics for a deal, trust me. Go with this one.

Reviews.Title: Fiance loves it
Reviews.Author: S. Stroud
Reviews.Content: Fiancé had this exact camera until it was stolen and pawned.  We were headed for a family vacation at an indoor water park and wanted family photos with the kids.  This camera survived the hot tubs, water slides, lazy river, ect, ect.  Very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Broke the second day of use on cruise.
Reviews.Author: Stacy Langley
Reviews.Content: Camera fell out of my bag which was about 1-1.5 ft drop.  After this, the camera would only take black pictures.  The camera states it is shock proof up tp 5ft.  I had to purchase another camera while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: SOOOOO Disappointed
Reviews.Author: William Kirsch
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for her college research trip to Belize.  The camera worked for 2 days before failing.  Total bummer as her trip is 17 days and she needed it for documentation.  Her quote:  "My camera stopped working.  Water got into the screen."  I feel terrible about this.

Reviews.Title: Tough Camera
Reviews.Author: JayJay
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife as she is hard on cameras. To this point it has worked very well. It has been dropped at least twice and continues to function. I expect several more years of proper operation.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Greg S. Churilov "wootheweb"
Reviews.Content: I had one, but I left it unattended and it was stolen. I now bought a second one. Love it. Just loaned it to a friend for her Bora Bora honeymoon and she was gushing about all the crystal-clear snorkeling underwater photos they took. :-)

Reviews.Title: Perfect Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Davis
Reviews.Content: This is a must buy if you are going to the beach. It is easy to use and takes great pictures. It is very durable and held up to a week long beach vacation and kids using it. It was in the sand, salt water, dropped, and never missed a heat. I am very happy with this product!

Reviews.Title: Great family fun vacation camera
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: I got this to go on a family vacation. I'm truly glad I did. It was such fun to be able to take photos of the kids playing at the beach and in the pool. We now have some wonderful memories to keep forever thanks to the crisp, clear photographs and video this camera takes.

Reviews.Title: Item delivered on time, was as described.
Reviews.Author: crabman
Reviews.Content: When ordered I wasn't sure if this camera was what I needed but I am happy with the purchase. Expectations exceeded. I recommend for under water use.

Reviews.Title: Ecellent Product
Reviews.Author: Beth Wager
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use!!  I was able to take sports shots at a hockey game and zoom in with a clear picture.  The only flaw is when using the video feature the picture darkens significantly. Otherwise this is the perfect go to camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Abandoned Me
Reviews.Author: Travis Hostetter "Gunner43"
Reviews.Content: I own an older version of this camera that I paid $400 for on Amazon.  I used the camera lightly and after just one month of sparing usage, the camera broke and took in water.  I never went below the depth prescribed nor kept the camera in the water for more than a few minutes.  Panasonic was incredibly difficult to get ahold of on the phone and when I did, they were not helpful.  I eventually found a form to fill out online and sent it with the camera back to Panasonic.  After many months, they finally sent me a replacement used camera.  However, the very next time I used it, it broke.  Now Panasonic has refused to repair the camera I sent to them and I am out $400.Terrible customer service, poor picture and video quality, and it is certainly not waterproof.  DO NOT BUY!

Reviews.Title: WORKED VERY WELL
Reviews.Author: Ms.Velazquez
Reviews.Content: Works very well. Many camera options. Feel secure around water ,.,.park. Didn'tt include flash drive or case.  Nevertheless feel very satisfied with the camera color and features and PRICE.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera.
Reviews.Author: L. Fernandez
Reviews.Content: It can really take a beating, beach, sand, salt water, a 2 year old toddler, pool. If you happen to get sand around the shutter button just rinse it in water and you're good.Obviously you aren't going to get DSLR quality pictures, but they're ok.It serves it purpose.

Reviews.Title: Great fun underwater pics
Reviews.Author: J. Garcia
Reviews.Content: Love it. I compared cameras before I bought this one. The underwater pictures in a pool are amazing.  Also took some pictures while playing with my kids in the Ocean. Just great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason Townsend
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use underwater for a snorkeling vacation. The pictures look very good, but I will say that it was hard to see the LCD screen underwater.  I had no issues with the camera down to about 20' underwater but that is as deep as I went.

Reviews.Title: I bought this for $84 on sale, at that price it is great
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is so-so, lcd screen on the back is just ok.  But for $84 to have a waterproof, shock proof camera to use and not worry about.  Yeah, I can deal with that.  I'll keep my Canon Elph for better pictures, but this is nice to have for beach days.

Reviews.Title: go for it
Reviews.Author: Mexisalva
Reviews.Content: Camera work great. Takes great picture under water. If you are Looking for an easy to use camera this is the one.

Reviews.Title: just a fine camera - pictures were not fabulous though
Reviews.Author: lkp "gracie parra"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my family vacation to Hawaii.  I was very excited to get some great underwater pictures...well the pictures were not so wonderful.  Yes, the water may not have been crystal blue, but the color was not vibrant in the underwater pictures at all.  Maybe I was expecting too much, I don't know.  If you were really close to what you were photographing the pictures were fine, but forget about it if you are more than about 8 -12 inches away.  As far as taking pictures outside of the water, my iPhone does a much better job.  Long story short, this camera will be mostly used by my children...

Reviews.Title: Worked out perfectly!
Reviews.Author: lnd6c2
Reviews.Content: This camera worked out perfectly for our cruise - we had it in the ocean and down the water slides, but it also looked sleek enough to bring along to dinner.  The different functions were great, too, like the panoramic.  Very pleased with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: opened underwater
Reviews.Author: Ginnyesq
Reviews.Content: the camera seemed nice, but when I got up from snorkeling the first time I noticed that the lock had been unlocked.  It just have bumped my arm--too easy to unlock.  I got no photos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Job Site Camera
Reviews.Author: RJV Engineer
Reviews.Content: This is a rugged compact camera.  I needed a small pocket camera for construction site documentation.  It takes high resolution pictures with automatic settings.  The zoom lets you get close to a higher object.  The auto close up let's you take a close up detail of a weld.  Tested it on a quarter.  Set the camera on it a got a detailed close up.The manual is 150 pages of special features that is way beyond what I expected for an economical camera.  I haven't had time to explore all of these.The best thing is I don't have to worry if I drop it or if it rains.The only issues I have is that the lens is in the upper left corner.  It is easy to get your fingers over it.  The zoom button is also easy to hit unintentionally.It took a while to figure out how to stop the warning message for under water use from showing every time you turned it on.Note you have to get an SD card.  It has minimal internal memory.  Maybe 15 shots.Extra batteries will be needed if you use the flash a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera was the perfect purchase for my cruise.  It was tough, easy to carry, and took great photos.  The battery life is excellent.  I fully charged it about two weeks before the cruise and did not charge it at all during the week-long cruise even though I used it every day.  I used the camera underwater in both the ocean and a pool and had no issues.  If you are wondering what kind of memory card to get (you'll need one), I bought a 64 GB SD XC card and the camera indicated a capacity of over 9500 highest quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Such a nice camera
Reviews.Author: Tricia Elkinton "Mom of Three"
Reviews.Content: This camera was just what I needed for our last cruise.  I was afraid that for this price it wouldn't really be all that great, but it was.  Underwater pics are great.  Just remember to change the setting to "underwater".  Small and compact.  I never had to recharge the battery and we snorkeled for around 6 hours.  If only the fish had been as good as the camera :)

Reviews.Title: humedity no good for this
Reviews.Author: Fernando Diaz
Reviews.Content: Panoramic pics are awesome. Needs to improve underwater photos, it takes with a lot of bright. Also the lens got blur when I took the camera to a place with high levels of humedity, I wasnt able to take pics there anymore. The "normal" pics are great, good quality and definition

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Amee R. Penso
Reviews.Content: I had to replace my old one so I got another. I love this camera. Does great underwater shots. My only complaint is that is was mailed in a padded envelope and the box was a bit crushed. The camera was okay. The same day I had replacement batteries arrive in box. Fast shipping!

Reviews.Title: happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice compact camera that takes decent underwater pics.  Make sure to set the mode to beach/water and the underwater pics come out nice.  It was a little hard seeing the screen underwater at times, but for a relatively inexpensive camera that is waterproof I am pleased.  No problems with leakage.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: dmh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Mexico where we used our Lumix DMC-TS25 for the first time.  We had great pictures.  The only downside is that sometimes we would get water spots on the glass over the lense, you just needed to remember to wipe it off.  We even had great pictures of the fish underwater.  The inside pics were not the best, but that isn't really why we got the camera in the first place.  If you are looking for a waterproof camera that won't break the bank, and will give you good photos - this is for you!  (I saw lots of comments about the camera leaking - never had a problem with that, there is a lever on the side that you need to slide to ensure the camera is locked closed and everytime after the door has been opened there is a message to check the door that pops up.)  You will also definitely want a floating camera strap - just in case.  We bought one from Nordic Quality that worked great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Debra S Rankin
Reviews.Content: This is easy to use and produces vibrant colors; underwater feature is great for vacations; tough enough for the kids to use

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: pam "military mom"
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old daughter is taking pictures and making movies.  The camera is rugged enough to survive all of my daughter adventures.  Pictures are solid and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: great!!!
Reviews.Author: Pablo Luis Lynn "Pablynn"
Reviews.Content: great price.nice pictures underwater.would definitely recommend.indoor and outdoor, easy to use.we went snorkeling and have a blast!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - perfect for snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Kelly Olsen
Reviews.Content: Despite some reviews of this camera not being that great, I ordered it prior to a trip to the Caribbean and it was amazing! I took 950 photos, half of them underwater, and all of them turned out amazing! I love the in-camera filters available and got some fun shots that way. I would not hesitate to recommend this camera (just for reference, I have a Powershot and and Olympus PEN-E 1 and I like this camera as much as both of those). The settings in the underwater feature allow for increased color variation which is really nice considering the colors get pretty muted starting at about 5 feet. I am really happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great for kids weekend
Reviews.Author: deb ausen
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera underwater.. however, the "above water" shots seemed overexposed.  I think it may be something I am doing wrong, but cant seem to figure it out.  I bought it mostly for family shoots for a snorkel weekend... and for the "selfies" it was WONDERFUL.  It takes some time to get good photos of the fish, but we did manage to get better as the weekend went on.  Good value for the price Thank You

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot WATERPROOF CAMERA with Video
Reviews.Author: jw
Reviews.Content: For our Cancun vacation I was debating whether to take my D7100 Nikon DSLR which takes great photos.  This time however, I wanted to take underwater photos as well.  Did some research and underwater housing for D7100 was expensive so I thought this was a good time to buy a secondary camera that is small, waterproof, captures decent video for under $200.  So I did some extensive research and initially waterproof cameras from Nikon and Canon came to mind but since this was my secondary camera I wanted to keep it below $200.  If this was my primary camera, I would of spent little more and would of likely purchased Canon, Nikon and even Olympus in the price range of $200-$400.First of all, this is my first point and shoot camera and I am quite surprised by the image quality, especially for a camera that I spent in the low $100. I want to emphasize at this price point because it's unfair to compare a low $100 camera to $1200 Nikon with a $500 lens.  Unfortunately, when we first arrived at Cancun, it was cloudy and raining.  So the pictures taken on the beach are somewhat grainy (I am carefully viewing the photos as I write on a computer screen), but the next days were sunny and the photos quality are somewhat comparable to my Nikon DSLR.  So the overall image quality is there, especially something that is very small to carry around and that can easily slide into your pocket.  Pictures taken inside the hotel during the daytime came out great.  At night, pictures taken with flash came out pretty clear.Afterwards, I went kayaking and submerged this camera underneath the water.  With the large LCD display, I was able to see the ocean bottom from the kayak.  Took several pictures and they came out OK most likely because the water was somewhat murky.  So I really couldn't test the image quality of underwater pictures because the water was not clear.  Then I changed to video mode, and using the default mode the video came out somewhat grainy for both out of water and under water.  I really didn't have time to read the manual and change any settings since the camera came a day before our vacation.  But I really didn't expect high quality video like my HD Canon camcorder.  According to the manual, it captures 720P video.Overall I took over 450 pictures and about 7 minutes of video using a 16GB SDHC memory card and used up only 3.33 GB of memory (approximately 11.5 GB of free space), and fully charged camera about two times during my three days stay at Cancun.  Unless you are taking hundreds of pictures in a day, I do not believe a second battery is necessary.  In the default video mode, 16GB of SDHC memory gave approximately 30 minutes of video recording time.Sure it would of been nice to have a camera that will take better pictures during low light or better quality video, but for the price I really can't complain.  If you want a waterproof camera with high quality video, I would recommend looking at other waterproof cameras with video capability.  But for me, I was quite surprised by this Panasonic underwater camera and it definitely makes an excellent secondary camera  that I can easily carry around.  So out of 450 images, I would say that over 95 percent of the images are keepers that I can print although not perfect.  Oh by the way, the camera focus is pretty fast for a point and shoot.  Obviously, the waterproof works great, otherwise I would of have no underwater pictures, but if there is one improvement (not a complaint) it would have to be the video quality.  My wife and my kids love this camera and I will likely report back once it gets more usage.

Reviews.Title: Great Waterproof Camer
Reviews.Author: Jerry VanOort
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a vacation to Mexico so I could take photos in the pool and ocean and around sand.  It performed flawlessly and allowed me to take some great photos.  Just make sure you allow the camera to adjust to the different microclimates as the lens can easily fog up when you get near the ocean.  You just need to give it a few minutes to acclimate and the fog will go away.  I would also make sure that you read the instruction carefully on how to properly maintain the watertight door.  The video is sub-par at best which was a little disappointing but far from being a deal breaker.  I plan on buying a GoPro camera for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Momof4
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera. I bought this for my 9 yr old and it's been a huge hit. The fact that it's shock proof and waterproof only make it more practical and cooler.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great while it worked - for 5 days
Reviews.Author: Robert Hawke
Reviews.Content: We bought this for snorkeling in Mexico. We followed all the instructions about closing it properly, only taking it in the water for 1 hour, rinsing it after salt water use, etc. And for the first five days this camera gave us great pictures and we were really impressed how this little camera can work so well AND be waterproof. If our vacation had been 5 days long this would be a 5 star review.On the 6th day when we got in the water the LCD screen started to fog from the inside. So no way to wipe it off. It's not water inside, probably just air with a different temperature that starts to condensate. This was only annoying but at least it still took pictures. A few minutes later the lens started to fog on the inside. Now it was useless because the pictures taken were foggy. After 15 minutes in the water the fog disappeared (probably because the temperature inside got equal to the water temperature). From that point on the camera was ok when outside the water, but would get foggy every time it was put in the water and if we got lucky after maybe 15-20 minutes it would clear up, but not always. As soon as the fog disappears it's still ok to use and on land you wouldn't notice a thing.Summary: Great camera, but if you really want to use it for underwater pictures, consider it a disposable camera. Ours is going back to Amazon and for our next vacation we will look for something better.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working the first time it got wet
Reviews.Author: S. Little
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to Bali and Japan, and I ran it under faucet water before the trip to be sure it didn't take in any water, and seemed fine. I used it for the first 4 days of our trip, and on the last day in Bali before we headed to Japan, I took it into the pool for about 10 seconds, and it stopped working properly. There was no water in the battery compartment, but water got into the screen area, and not only was the LCD screen completely shot, but all photos were totally blurry. I tried drying everything out over several days, but nothing worked. Luckily, we had a backup camera on a phone, but I was extremely disappointed that I couldn't capture better photos from this trip of a lifetime. Even the photos that were taken before it stopped working were not as good quality as I would hope. I would not purchase this camera again, even if I weren't planning to get it wet.

Reviews.Title: Great dependable camera!
Reviews.Author: Honey Badger
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Panasonic TS25 about 3 weeks ago.It is the first waterproof camera I have ever owned. The excellent way it's doing it's job right now, it may be the only one I ever own. Delivery was fast and the package came in great shape!The camera is a neat little thing. It weighs almost nothing at all and feels sturdy to the touch. For the price tag being so reasonable, I think this was worth every penny and then some! At first glance, I thought the buttons on the camera were in no way going to stop water from leaching into the camera! However, that misconception was blown away when I took it to the beach for some great snapshots of underwater seaweed. There were no problems whatsoever.  I put it on it's side on top of a towel for about 30 minutes and it was dry and ready to go! I made note to keep the battery hatch closed during drying due to reading reviews stating that doing so may fog the lens.I stayed at the beach taking various pictures using all kinds of options and software built into the camera. The options to edit photos kept me so amused that I missed several great potential shots! As it got darker, I switched to night sky option and took some shots of the horizon after the last bit of sun sank below. The shots came out gorgeous! Better than what I expected. It captured the stars that were barely coming out as if they were out in full effect. The camera picked up stars I couldn't even see!I later had trouble keeping my hands steady enough so I put the TS25 on a tripod. By this time, it was complete night. The moon was full and there were no city lights within miles. The shots were even more amazing with the tripod. For what I consider a budget camera, this thing took very nice shots of the night sky. There's no trouble telling which constellations are which from the photos.Overall, great product!

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera for cheap
Reviews.Author: llauren
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in August 2013 for a vacation to the Florida Keys. We took the camera with us on our first snorkeling dive. The camera worked wonderfully! We used the camera several times since then and never had it leak. It takes very good land photographs too, which we were happily surprised about. The settings are easy to use. We added a lanyard on to the camera so we would not lose the camera in the rough waves as it does not float. The colors are vivid on land and in water, though i am a terrible photographer so i did not tinker with many settings like i should have underwater.[TIP] If you keep the lens free of debris and bubbles while underwater it will focus beautifully, but if there are even the tiniest bubbles caught on the lens it will auto-focus on those instead of your subject.Here are some sample raw, unedited photos taken on land, and in water.(on land) [...](on land) [...](underwater) [...](underwater) [...]We did notice, the larger the field we were trying to photograph/the farther away from the subject we were, the more washed out the underwater scenery came out in the photos. On the other hand, close-up photos came out AMAZING; vivid, and sharp in focus!

Reviews.Title: bad instructions on how to use internal memory (70 Gigs) vs. the SD card
Reviews.Author: Carlos Danger
Reviews.Content: It's durable.  It was great on a trip where it was raining and by the ocean when the wind was spraying the ocean and it's nice not to worry about having to get it wet or drop it.  Although I would not want to drop this thing on concrete from more than about a foot, it's nice to have piece of mind.What is annoying me is that it has 70 Gigabytes of internal memory and a slot for an SD card but they aren't really clear in the listing that you don't need an SD cart at all if you are OK with the 70 Gigs of internal memory, which I am fine with.  So I wasted money on an SD card I feel like.  I am also annoyed because I am sitting here with this camera and I've gone through all of the set-up and settings on the camera and looked through the instructions and cannot figure out how to switch from the internal memory to the SD card.I was on vacation and filled the internal memory but then I could not get it to switch to the SD card.  OK, and maybe I am flaking on something and maybe I have not done a good enough Google search on how to do it.  Probably there is a way to do it but I am pretty good at figuring this kind of thing out and going on a few hours now, I have not been able to figure it out.  So let me lower this down to 3 stars as I become more annoyed about as I am writing it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: I had higher expectations for this 16 mp camera... The low quality screen turned me off right away. My 10mp Nikon s350 from 2009 takes nicer pictures than this. If you only plan to use this camera under water then maybe its good ( I returned it before trying it underwater) but I did compare it in a store to the fugifilm underwater camera in this price range and the fugi's pictures were much more clear. I returned this camera the next day.

Reviews.Title: Tough, Waterproof...Horrible Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Pd
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for a trip and didn't want to worry about it when by the water. Well it's great for that, but not much else. The biggest problem is the picture quality...its horrible. Every once in a while we can get a clear picture, but most of the time it's blurry and unusable. So if you're in the market for a fun electronic toy for water and toughness, sure. But don't count on getting any quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Durable and great photos
Reviews.Author: FL mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband who is tough on electronics. It has survived thus far, including water and falls. The photos are very nice, as are videos. It is a durable and easy to use camera. The 'warning" when you turn on about leaking is annoying, but we haven't taken the time to bypass it like the reviewers and the manual tell you. Overall, very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Thomas Nichols jr
Reviews.Content: worked perfect Got this for a cruise we went on to Jamica, cozemel and the camen Islands. Perfect shots and worked well in the water

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Natalie Shubert
Reviews.Content: One of the best I have ever used. There isn't any negative I have to say about it. Love it

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!
Reviews.Author: Nickelmack
Reviews.Content: I used to have the slightly cheaper and less awesome version of this camera, and it was amazing. The upgrade is PHENONIMAL!! I have taken this camera hiking, white-water rafting, camping, on cruises, on road trips... I have dropped it, I have swam in the ocean with it, I have really given it a run for the money, and it is WORTH EVERY PENNY!

Reviews.Title: Great photos for a waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful for anything with a chance of water interaction. As long as you follow the directions with the camera and rinse it when you're supposed to, you should have no problems. I've had it for about 5 months and it has survived the ocean, multiple lakes and pouring rain, all successful and camera still works like new.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera!
Reviews.Author: Brigitte Malessa
Reviews.Content: Great camera for underwater snapshots. I have used it regularly in water that is about 50 degrees to take pictures of fish. Works great, the Hi Burst mode is great and takes LOTS of frames per second.

Reviews.Title: Tough
Reviews.Author: Ronald Sievers "Ron"
Reviews.Content: My wife has destroyed more cameras than I can remember.  This one has survived a trip to Alaska where between us we took 2000+ pictures.  i merged her pictures and mine that were take from a Canon into albums.  I often retained her shot as the best one.  Picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Good Tough Camera
Reviews.Author: CPAT21
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily to take along on my obstacle course races. I most recently took it to Run For Your Lives. It worked great throughout the race. First thing I did with this camera was drop it on the hard packed ground at the event, oops. No issues with that. From there it went through some nasty mud and water also with no issue taking great photos the entire time. I can't wait to bring it with me on a Tough Mudder.My secondary use for this was to use at the beach while traveling instead of my SLR. I had it out at the ocean with sand and salt water all over it and it never skipped a beat.The bonus aspect is I can let my 6 year old daughter use it whenever she likes and I don't worry about her breaking my high end SLR.The only reason I didn't give the camera 5 stars is that I've had multiple shots that were taken in bright light and the whites have no contrast. I found this happened outside in a few photos at Disney and SeaWorld. I'm sure there is probably a setting I could use to offset that, but at the time I was taking the picture I couldn't tell there was an issue.I would highly recommend this camera for someone using it in similar fashion to myself.

Reviews.Title: I received only the camera without important accesories
Reviews.Author: Rosa Rangel
Reviews.Content: I received the camera but it was not included the cable USB neither batteries. I prefer to pay a little more but with the main acceosries included. I have to submit another order. (:

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: christopher h.
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics in and out of water.  This has to  be the most durable, overall best  point and shoot I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures and a durable camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel Weaver
Reviews.Content: This is the second owned in our family.  Takes great photos. Would definitely recommend this for those who want a more durable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for underwater and above ground pictures!
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I returned two underwater digital before sticking with this even the new Nikon Coolpix. This camera surpassed them all! Great buy. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: bought for beach vacation
Reviews.Author: Joy Tunesi
Reviews.Content: I was looking at more expensive water cameras but ended up getting this one.i am glad i did it did everything i needed it to on our trip to Turks and Caicos.it was small could be taken everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great for a small easy to use camera you can throw in your bag.
Reviews.Author: frog lady
Reviews.Content: Great for a small easy to use camera you can throw in your bag. The battery life is also great

Reviews.Title: This made the Hawaiin waters sparkle!
Reviews.Author: Alaskan Cajun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got married in Hawaii and this camera helped us save a lot of memories.  I could not be happier with the pictures (in the water and out of the water).  If you're on the fence about a waterproof camera, I highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: Overall really happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Rory C Smith
Reviews.Content: It has great battery life, takes really good photos in and out of the water, the only down side is that the zoom level isn't all that great - but thats the price you pay for being able to take photos underwater.

Reviews.Title: A fun, easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Ruthie
Reviews.Content: This is the smallest camera I have ever owned, about the size of my phone, but it takes way better pictures. I use it when canoeing and it sits in water a lot of the time, with no problems so far. I just have to remember to dry off the lens. I use a floating strap, just in case I drop the camera. The pictures look great when viewed on my computer. Haven't printed any yet. It was very easy to use right from the start.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Water Resistant Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Jo Finer
Reviews.Content: I'm going to take this camera snorkeling, but in the meantime I've been using it around the house, and I'm very impressed with how easy it is to understand all of the adjustments and the quality of the pictures is excellent!

Reviews.Title: This camera is easy to use!
Reviews.Author: gjw
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  It is easy to you and takes good pictures.  I bought a float for my wrist that I use with this.  The pictures transfer easily to my pc (no special software needed to be installed).  It also takes video and has zoom.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful photos
Reviews.Author: Brenda Fink
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised how great the photos are. The camera is very easy to use. I love the color.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the beach.
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Best waterproof digital for the price. Long battery life, good photos, nice zoom, easy to use. Only draw back is 720 not 1080p, but for making videos 720 requires significantly less storage and still makes great video.  My 8 year old loves to use the camera, and this one survived a beach trip.Definately would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Richard A Meier
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert at cameras but I have to say that this one added a lot of value to family's first trip to Hawaii.  The kids were so excited to show us the turtles and fish the found while snorkeling.  It was great fun to take pix of them and fish myself.  Video works great.  Easy to use.  Underwater mode is awesome.  Very cool for the money.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS25 Tough Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice and the  White color is perfect.  it takes great pictures and is easy to use.I recommend it to young and old.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: MMH434 "MH"
Reviews.Content: waterproof, shockproof, and definately friend-proof...for those with butterfingers...very good pictures in a small package without all the wifi, bells and whistles.  Rocks.

Reviews.Title: Tough Little Camera
Reviews.Author: John Mullen
Reviews.Content: Kind of like today's crossover SUVs, which can handle a little bit of everything but not the Baja 500, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS25 can handle most things a family with young children can throw at it. It takes less than 1 second to power up and can start taking pictures right after that. With a dedicated Video Record button you're always ready to take HD Video. My only complaint is that the camera (as a whole) and the controls are just a little too small for my addled fingers. My wife has absolutely no problems with the camera. This camera has become our everyday-take everywhere camera.

Reviews.Title: Great, easy, underwater camera, not super sharp, but how could it be?
Reviews.Author: D. Fogel
Reviews.Content: Nice, easy to use.  Love the Panasonic menus.  We bought this for our 15 year old daughter for her birthday.  She has used it in pools and in the ocean and it works great.

Reviews.Title: It works!!
Reviews.Author: Prudence Brooks
Reviews.Content: This camera did very well under water.  The color was good and there was no leakage during use or during the cleaning process..  My only complaint is that the camera is a little slow.  I have been using a faster camera so it took a while to become accustomed to the slower speed.

Reviews.Title: As promised
Reviews.Author: Moma Imports LLC
Reviews.Content: Brought this for a water based vacation.  Taking photos at the high resolution only allows like 15 shots but lower resolution turned out good. There is a slight delay when taking a picture. It is also very hard to see the screen under water but the camera worked, the pictures were great. It performed as promised. I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Camera worth the price
Reviews.Author: Joanel
Reviews.Content: The camera was bought for a trip to Mexico.  I wanted to take pics underwater.  It worked great!  I had no issues with it, in fact, it turned out to be the only camera we used for the entire vacation.  I highly recommend this camera.  I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Kim Kingsford
Reviews.Content: We really went back and forth on whether to spend the extra $200 to get the model up but decided this would probably work for our trip.  We are happy we saved the money, this is a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: absolutely amazing camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jose
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations in every possible way. Can't do better for $130... I use it asa work / vacation camera and is working great. Haven't tried and probably won't try the underwater feature since it has gone really bad in previous versi8ns, for me it's just a plus to be able tu use it in the rain or near the pool.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: bellona yuan
Reviews.Content: Good camera for price. Didn't have a problem with the underwater setting. Yes, being underwater it wasn't as clear but still worked great in and out of the water.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera does everything and great pictures I would definitely recommend. Florida vacation was great with this camera. Needs more than one battery for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Kids
Reviews.Author: csearer
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 9 year old's birthday. He wanted a camera and I was not about to buy him a camera that wasn't rugged enough to take the drops, spills, and thrills of a 9 year old. Takes good pictures for what it is. Low light situations are not it's specialty. If you're looking for a camera that you know is going to take abuse, this is a great choice. The menu is pretty easy to navigate and the battery last a good amount of time. If you're looking for something that take first rate pictures, spend a bit more money and get a better camera with a nicer lens and more shooting options.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Linda Mcnamara "lemcnamara"
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and reminds you to make sure the door for the battery and media card it closed and locked. Light weight and long lasting battery. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Does the trick!
Reviews.Author: david lam
Reviews.Content: Was waterproof to ~ 20ft.  Pictures and videos in ocean and on water slide were good.  No issues.  I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Ngina Wilson
Reviews.Content: Nice pictures that it takes, the pictures are clear and it is easy to operate. I like the color of the camera. I have not used the feature yet, but saying that is waterproof is a nice feature just in case something may spill on it.

Reviews.Title: Flash pictures have issues......
Reviews.Author: James S. Middleton
Reviews.Content: Started out good.  Pictures/sensor started showing hotspots, circles, in flash pictures.  Sent in for warranty exchange.  Refurb does same thing.  Non-flash pictures great.  Flash pictures have little circles look like water drops, hot spots.  Not happy.  Not a cheap camera.Just contacted Panasonic AGAIN.....12.17.2013 UPDATEWell Panasonic agrees the refurb replacement camera needs repairs. Gee.... BUT they just sent me a bill for almost 200 dollars that they want ME to pay to do so.Really?It is still under warranty.Talk about lousy customer service. I called the phone number and it is an automated operator. You can't speak to a person. I tried every way imaginable and I could not get to a human being. So I faxed all documents, sales receipts, emails, etc., and wrote on the fax for them to call me.....I'll never buy Panasonic again.

Reviews.Title: Tough waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: K.V.
Reviews.Content: I bought this in July to take kayaking, both flat water and white water. I gotta say: I have beaten the crap out of this thing, and it's still going strong. It's definitely safe for water as long as you make sure it's closed properly. I always keep a float strap attached to it because I've dropped it in moving water more than once. the float strap is a life saver because the camera will sink. I've also dropped it on the hard ground more time than I can count. It's always falling out of something. The picture quality is good, not fantastic, but my pictures come out much better than anyone else's waterproof camera that I've seen. I rarely use it for video, but I'm thinking of finding a way to mount it on my kayak since my friends have so much trouble with their expensive Go Pros. Battery life is solid. For me, it lasts about 2-3 days turning it off and on, maybe 1 day it's getting heavy use. If you want a good outdoor camera, especially for water, this is a great pick. I've been very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "radise"
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for a week now and have used it just about anywhere. Have taken the camera to the pool, in the ocean and more. I love it. It works better then I thought it would and the images quality is very good for such a compact camera. If looking for a waterproof machine for everyday use I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in preparation for a day at SeaWorld, after reading blogs saying don't bring a high end camera & buy a waterproof one. However, since I have a fair amount of money in my DSLR, I needed to stay economical. The Lumix has been to pools, SeaWorld, & scuba diving at Key West and has been everything advertised. Good pics & easy to operate; well worth the price & now my daughter is buying one.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot for the money!
Reviews.Author: Rick Neller
Reviews.Content: I bought  this camera for my honeymoon in the Bahamas.  I was planning to do lots of swimming and watersports and needed something waterproof.  I decided to give this one a shot at it, not really expecting much and just hoping it would survive long enough to give me some good honeymoon shots.  It did a great job.  For a point and shoot, I was pleasantly surprised by the image quality.  I had this camera in my swimsuit pocket most of the week, kept it in there in the pool and took it snorkeling and jetskiing in the ocean.  It was nice to have the opportunity to just take this out and take a picture no matter where I was and what I was doing.  I plan on doing a good bit of river running with this camera as well.

Reviews.Title: Died during vacation - adding insult to injury is have to pay shipping to get it repaired
Reviews.Author: JustADad "JustADad"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a month before our vacation to Mexico.  It died during our trip - would not power on after confirming that the battery was charged.  Great.  No camera.  Got back to the USA and found out that I had to pay shipping to get it repaired under warranty.I have a handful of photos from it, and the quality is not as good as the old, low end Canon camera I have.  I really wish I could have just returned it and purchased another brand/model, but I was five days outside the return window.I've been a Canon guy for years, and this was not a good way to convert me to Panasonic....

Reviews.Title: Breaks easily
Reviews.Author: David Weinstein
Reviews.Content: Broke easily while swimming underwater in the ocean (snorkeling, held within 2 feet of the surface).  I had a previous Lumix which broke while swimming in the ocean, so i was extra careful that this Lumix was being handled properly.  Even though the seal was locked properly, it broke after being underwater for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: STOPPED WORKING THE FIRST TIME IT GOT WET!!!
Reviews.Author: John M. LaSala
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a college field trip for our daughter. They needed to photo document their research of a coral reef for her studies major. The camera froze up after one snorkel trip and stopped working completely. Needless to say she will have difficulty with this class since she now has to rely on photos taken by the other students. Obviously we are completely disappointed and will be returning the camera for a refund.

Reviews.Title: photos are blurry!
Reviews.Author: annielogan
Reviews.Content: before going on a beach vacation, i took some photos at a birthday party. i took about 100 photos and when i looked at the photos on my computer, not one photo was clear! each picture was blurry, nothing was sharp, and the colors were awful!! -- and this was out of the water! i ended up returning this and buying the Olympus underwater camera. it was almost double the price, but it was definitely worth it when i saw the crystal clear, gorgeous photos of my vacation, both underwater, on land, low light, everywhere... definitely don't waste your money on this piece of garbage.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof at all
Reviews.Author: aobeachgirl "aobeachgirl"
Reviews.Content: Failed on first trip into water.  Took great pictures up until then, but the whole point was for it to work in water.  I followed directions exactly (and this is my second Lumix-- the first one worked fine in water) and so I don't think it was anything I did.

Reviews.Title: Oversold, under-delivered.
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Picture quality isn't very good and certainly not better than an iPhone.  The 8x zoom, to me, was inaccurate.  It's actually a 4x zoom with software enhancements which Panasonic feels doubles the image zoom capability.  We got it for someone as a gift- now we feel embarrassed as its just not a very good quality camera- certainly not for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for newbies
Reviews.Author: vmm312 "ViMa"
Reviews.Content: I'm not an expert on cameras. I was looking for a good, stable point and shoot that could survive rougher trips like camping and the beach. So far I'm pleased with the quality of pictures that I've taken. I haven't dropped it so I'm not sure of the toughness, but I've taken it to 6 flags, and it survived being splashed on. I also got it the floating wrist, just in case.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Michael Robinson
Reviews.Content: I brought the camera for my wife. the flash works in one second and thats great, no more pressing hard and blurry pictures.

Reviews.Title: First Screen Asks SAME QUESTION EVERY TIME.
Reviews.Author: Wynette L. Weaver
Reviews.Content: The reason I like point and shoots is that you can whip the camera out of your pocket to your eye and get the shot when it happens. Not with this camera because a message appears about being careful if you are using it underwater. When you click the shutter another message appears saying something about Do you want to review how to use underwater? Then you have to slide a slider from YES to NO and press shutter again.  Good luck getting that great shot that has now gotten away.  This camera got a rave review for the price and now I remember at the very end was one line saying something like, "The only annoyance is the screen that asks if you are using the camera underwater"  This is more than an 'annoyance'.  I don't think there is a way to undo this message.

Reviews.Title: Blue lines in HD video
Reviews.Author: Flat Stanley
